name: Kepler-242
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-242 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-242 is a star with 0.7450000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located 1991.51 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-242 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-242 b

Kepler-242 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.20 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-242.

The mass of Kepler-242 b is 9.63 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-242 b is 2.61 that of Earth. At 9.63 Earth masses, Kepler-242 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-242 c

Kepler-242 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 14.50 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-242.

The mass of Kepler-242 c is 5.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-242 c is 2 that of Earth. At 5.05 Earth masses, Kepler-242 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-242, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
